revised_title: Inquiry into the Quantity and Direction of Arcturus' Proper Motion and Remarks on the Diminution of the Obliquity of the Ecliptic
tldr: The author investigates the proper motion of Arcturus, a prominent star in the constellation Boötes, and provides a detailed analysis of its direction and quantity. The study compares historical observations made by other astronomers, such as Dr. Halley, Mr. Cassini, and Mr. Flamsteed, with the author's own observations, and discusses the implications of the star's movement on the understanding of celestial mechanics.
